messages: a6586867bed039608abc3b83088c9573 (14:17): is there a way to roll back a transaction
a6586867bed039608abc3b83088c9573 (14:18): we just updated a table and updated 3000 reconds
a6586867bed039608abc3b83088c9573 (14:18): and w where not supposed to
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:23): Liquid-Silence: well. if you did use transactions, just don't commit?
a6586867bed039608abc3b83088c9573 (14:23): bigfoot- he did it from the mysql console
a6586867bed039608abc3b83088c9573 (14:23): so now we have to undo what he did

12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:25): IF you used transactions (ie. only innodb tables involved, autocommit switched off, BEGIN at the beginning), "ROLLBACK;" or just not committing should suffice...
a6586867bed039608abc3b83088c9573 (14:26): is the the issue
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:27): I don't know of a way to revert that. (maybe by using a possibly enabled binary log?)
a6586867bed039608abc3b83088c9573 (14:27): its from 10 hours back tho
f968110f23a255e1845556b6217d85e9 (14:38): Are session variables supposed to default to the global variable of the same name?
f968110f23a255e1845556b6217d85e9 (14:40): I'm able to set character-set-results to utf8 globally via default-character-set=utf8, but then sessions still use latin1 for character-set-results.
f968110f23a255e1845556b6217d85e9 (14:41): Now how do I make sessions use utf8 for character-set-results by default (without recompiling)?
04a9cb160efc41e8655471a8173afd0d (14:43): i want to store float numbers that could range from -9999.99 to 9999.99....what would i use? float(x?)
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:44): do you really want to store floating point numbers, or rather fixed point numbers?
04a9cb160efc41e8655471a8173afd0d (14:45): bigfoot-, its not anything crucial really.. whatever you would suggest to handle that number range
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:45): well. if you only want to limit the range, you should use a check constraint (mysql 5.x, afaik)...
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:46): but if you're storing something you want to make sure the decimals are right down to the latest digit, use fixed point numbers (DECIMAL)
04a9cb160efc41e8655471a8173afd0d (14:46): bigfoot-, looking for something simpler... i.e.... even varchar "would" work here... id just prefer a numeric type
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:46): I suggest using DECIMAL(6,2)
04a9cb160efc41e8655471a8173afd0d (14:47): ok thanks
a6586867bed039608abc3b83088c9573 (14:49): is what I use mostlu
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:49): Liquid-Silence: well. reread what he wants :)
d1bb8fbfbab74180e927de637449d3e2 (14:50): hey can any body tell me what is the NOT operator in mysql?
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:50): Cacious: negation!
d1bb8fbfbab74180e927de637449d3e2 (14:52): domas: could u plz look at this...."select distinct(`div`) from ACHST where regno!NULL;"
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:52): Cacious: this is invalid syntax... ! is a unary operator
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:52): Cacious: WHERE regno;
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:53): if you want to find entries, that are not null ;-)
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:53): Cacious: you might want to use  WHERE regno IS NOT NULL;
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:53): domas: and what about regnos that are 0?
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:53): will give you proper result

f968110f23a255e1845556b6217d85e9 (14:54): Hm. According to the docs session vars are indeed initialized from global vars. Then why is character-set-results initialized to latin1 when the global var is set to UTF-8? I experience this behaviour on both CentOS-3 (4.1.7) and CentOS-4 (4.1.12).
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:55): leonardjo_work: not connection
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:55): leonardjo_work: connnection character set is initialized by client
b0ffec9a4956e48c1fb5627ce62f8266 (14:55): i have a problem with a table who has a '-' in his name, how can a i do a select from this table? i try a lot of things but don`t work
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:55): domas: http://nopaste.php-q.net/214173 -- do you understand now why your suggestion is bad?
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:56): Cacious: or were you talking about 0?
d1bb8fbfbab74180e927de637449d3e2 (14:56): bigfoot: no man ...i refer to  the NULL values...
b0ffec9a4956e48c1fb5627ce62f8266 (14:56): domas: thanks
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:56): Cacious: then use WHERE regno IS NOT NULL.
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:57): bigfoot-: depends on server sql modes, I admit ;-)
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:57): domas: okay, is the behaviour different in ANSI mode? or what mode do you mean?
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:57): (I'm using the default settings, btw)
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:57): got to work I guess
f968110f23a255e1845556b6217d85e9 (14:57): domas, I'm speaking of results
8ca1954a9d263e1cab513ed4f44c897e (14:58): hi, suppose I have a query like this "select name from whatever" that returns one record... is it possible make mysql show this record for example 4 times?
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:58): leonardjo_work: 'set names ..' ;-)
d1bb8fbfbab74180e927de637449d3e2 (14:58): bigfoot-: But its not working .....even the null values are also getting selected...i dont know why its happening like that
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:58): select name,name,name,name ;-)
f968110f23a255e1845556b6217d85e9 (14:58): domas, I'd like to set this globally and once.
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:58): mua: four rows?
9cc307fbee8c01c6ca122eeaf3983a86 (14:58): /dev/null")
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:58): mua: or join it against a table that has four rows ;-)
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (14:59): leonardjo_work: there's startup option for you
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:59): mua: or use UNION
12409d7eed1215ddfc97c4066919a1e0 (14:59): mua: SELECT name FROM foo UNION SELECT name FROM foo; :-)
8ca1954a9d263e1cab513ed4f44c897e (14:59): thanks domas bigfoot-
